III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was "jumped" at the facility on 2/25/24 by peers. It is
unknown if youth suffered marks, bruise, or other injury. This
occurred while the children were outside. It is unknown what staff
were supervising at the time.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on February 27,
2024. Complainant did not have any additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth A said everyone was “chilling” at the
facility on February 25, 2024. Youth A said she was sitting in the
living room, refusing programming. Youth A said she decided to
go outside because Youth B was inside, and she did not want to
be near her. Youth A said she sat in a chair on the porch and
Youth B and Youth E kept running in and out of the door, while
Youth C, Youth D, and Youth F were outside with her painting.
Youth A said no staff were present outside at that time, and Youth
B started to walk towards her, so she backed up and Youth B
began to run at her, so she threw a chair at Youth B. Youth A said
Youth B then grabbed her by the hair and began to punch her.
Youth A said Youth E joined in by kicking and punching her. Youth
A said after about seven minutes Staff 1 came outside and got
Youth B off her at which time Youth C then began to assault her.
Youth A said Staff 1 then laid over her body to protect her from the
other youth and police sirens were heard and the youth stopped
the assault. Youth A said she was sent to the hospital for an
exam as she was bruised on her back and shoulder and had
scratches on her face. Youth A said when she returned to the
facility she was kept downstairs, away from all other youth.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth B said on February 25, 2024, all the
youth were outside with Staff 2. Youth B said earlier that day she
2

found out Youth A was talking about her, so she decided to ask
Youth A about this, and Youth A got upset and threw a chair at her
in the front yard. Youth B said Youth A then punched her and
attempted to poke her eye out. Youth B said she responded by
fighting back and began to beat Youth A up. Youth B said Youth C
and Youth E “jumped in to help” and then Staff 1 and Staff 2
“broke it up”. Youth B said the police and ambulance came to the
facility and took her, Youth A, and Youth E to the hospital for an
exam. Youth B said she had to have eye drops for her eye and
then was discharged from the hospital. Youth B said she returned
to the facility and “chilled” the rest of the night. Youth B said she
felt the staff did all they could in the situation.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth C said on February 25, 2024, she was
outside with four or five other youth unsupervised for “a couple
minutes” when Youth B came outside and walked up to Youth A
and asked her why she was talking about her. Youth C said Youth
A responded by asking Youth B if she wanted to fight and then
proceeded to swing a chair at Youth B. Youth C said this was
when staff came outside and Youth A swung the chair a second
time, hitting Youth B in the head. Youth C said Youth B and Youth
A began to fight and staff had to “break them up”. Youth C said
once a part Youth A grabbed a shovel and went after Youth E with
it, so Youth A and Youth E began to fight. Youth C said Youth E
was getting “beat up” so she began to kick Youth A to get her to
stop hurting Youth E. Youth C said Staff 2 was trying to stop
Youth A and Youth E but “it was not working”. Youth C said Youth
B came over and started to assault Youth A, at which time Staff 1
“laid on” Youth A in order to protect her. Youth C said the police
and ambulance showed up and the fighting stopped. Youth C said
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth E all were brought to the hospital for
an exam. Youth C said the staff did all they were able to stop the
fight. Youth C said “everyone” knows that Youth A and Youth B do
not get along.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth D said she was outside with Youth A,
Youth C, and Youth F on February 25, 2024. Youth D said there
were no staff outside with them. Youth D said Youth B walked
outside and began to argue with Youth A. Youth D saw Youth A
swing a chair at Youth B, missing one time but hitting her on the
second swing. Youth D said she called for staff and about five
minutes later Staff 2 went outside. Youth D said she went into the
living room because she was having an asthma attack. Youth D
said eventually an ambulance arrived and checked her out at the
3

facility. Youth D said normally staff are always present with the
youth.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth E said she was outside with Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C on February 25, 2024, with no staff
supervision. Youth E said Youth A hit Youth B with a chair and
they began to fight. Youth E said Staff 1 and Staff 2 came running
out of the house and separated Youth A and Youth B. Youth E
said Youth A began to fight with her and Staff 2 was trying to get
Youth A off her, but was not successful. Youth C began to assault
Youth A to try to get her to stop hurting Youth E. Youth E said
eventually Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were able to get all the
youth separated and the police and ambulance arrived and took
her to the hospital to be examined. Youth E said Youth A had bit
her hand and she was given medication for pain. Youth E said
once she returned from the hospital she was kept upstairs, away
from Youth A. Youth E said “everyone” knew that Youth A and
Youth B did not get along and “hated each other”.
Youth F was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth F said she was sitting outside with
Youth A on February 25, 2024, when Youth B came outside
yelling at Youth A. Youth F said she backed up to the van to be
out of the way. Youth F said Youth A grabbed a chair and began
to swing it at Youth B. Youth F said Staff 1 was by the trash can,
and Staff 3 came outside and called for Staff 2. Youth F said
Youth D began to have a panic attack and she went with her
inside. Youth F said she was inside for most of the fight and did
not see exactly what happened. Youth F said the police and an
ambulance showed up and Youth A, Youth B, and Youth E went
to the hospital. Youth F said the staff were all doing everything
they could to protect all the youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
26, 2024. Staff 1 said she was working with Staff 2 and Staff 3 on
February 25, 2024. Staff 1 said she was outside near the trash
container with a few of the youth. Staff 1 said Youth A was talking
with her and then she walked inside, and Staff 2 and Staff 3 were
left outside with the youth. Staff 1 said she was in the kitchen
preparing dinner and Staff 2 came inside with Youth D for less
than a minute to go downstairs to get an alternative dinner for
Youth D. Staff 1 said Staff 2 then went back outside. Staff 1 said
Youth B walked outside and she heard some yelling. She went
outside, and Youth B was on top of Youth A and Staff 2 was trying
to break them apart. Staff 1 said she began to help and was able
4

to get Youth B off Youth A and was standing next to her towards
the driveway while Staff 2 was near the house with Youth A. Staff
1 said Youth B yelled for Youth E to “get her” and Youth E began
to advance towards Youth A and Youth A grabbed a snow shovel
and hit Youth E. Staff 1 said she started to move towards Youth A
and Youth E when Youth B tripped her and she fell. Staff 1 said
Youth B ran to Youth A and was assaulting Youth A. Staff 1 said
as she was getting up and running over Youth C also joined Youth
B and Youth E in assaulting Youth A. Staff 1 said Youth B, Youth
C and Youth E were hitting and kicking Youth A, while Staff 2 and
Staff 3 were trying to separate all of them. Staff 1 said once she
got to Youth A, she chose to place her body hovering overtop of
Youth A to protect her from Youth B, Youth C and Youth E’s
assaultive actions. Staff 1 said someone yelled “you’re hurting
[Staff 1]” which made Youth B, Youth C, and Youth E stop the
assault. Staff 1 said the police and ambulance arrived and took
statements and brought Youth A, Youth B, and Youth E to the
hospital. Staff 1 said there was always a staff member outside
with the youth and the staff did all they were able to control and
stop the situation. Staff 1 said Youth A and Youth B do not get
along and there are safety plans in place to ensure supervision of
both youths.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on February
26, 2024. Staff 2 said she was working February 25, 2024, with
Staff 1 and Staff 3. Staff 2 said the house was running smoothly
and all of the youth were having a good day. Staff 2 said Youth A
was inside watching television in the living room, Youth B and
Youth E were playing a game in the medication room, and two
youth were outside painting when she went downstairs with Youth
D to get an alternative dinner option. Staff 2 said when she came
back upstairs, she went outside and saw Youth A outside with a
chair in her hands yelling at Youth B. Staff 2 said she stood in
front of Youth A and was trying to talk her into setting the chair
down. Staff 2 said Youth B began to roll up her pant legs
threatening to fight Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth A swung the chair
and hit her and then threw it and hit Youth B. Staff 2 said she
attempted to restrain Youth A but was unsuccessful and yelled to
the other youth to get Staff 1. Staff 2 said she was attempting to
separate Youth A and Youth B when Staff 1 came out and they
were able to get them apart. Staff 2 said Youth E then “got in
[Youth A’s] face” and Youth A grabbed a snow shovel and hit
Youth E. Staff 2 said she was attempting to stop Youth A and
Youth E from fighting while Staff 1 was keeping Youth B away
from Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth B got away from Staff 1 and
joined Youth E in assaulting Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth C joined
5

in and was kicking and hitting Youth A. Staff 2 said Staff 3 arrived
and was trying to help separate all the youth and Youth C grabbed
Staff 3 and threw her to the ground. Staff 2 said Staff 1 hovered
her body over Youth A to protect her and one of the youth kicked
Staff 1 and once they realized they were assaulting Staff 1 they
stopped and moved back. Staff 2 said the incident was about eight
minutes before it ended. Staff 2 said the police and ambulance
arrived and took Youth A, Youth B, and Youth E to the hospital for
an exam.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
11, 2024. Staff 3 said she was working with Staff 1 and Staff 2 on
February 25, 2024. Staff 3 said she was outside painting with
several youth in the afternoon. Staff 3 said Staff 2 came outside
so she went into the house in the kitchen. Staff 3 said Youth B
came into the kitchen and started telling Staff 1 that Staff 3 had
been talking about her behind her back. Staff 3 said Staff 1 walked
outside and she followed her telling her that what Youth B was
saying was not true. Staff 3 said Youth B was screaming in her
face so she told Staff 1 and Staff 2 she was going to take a quick
break and went into the medication room while Staff 1 and Staff 2
stayed outside with the youth. Staff 3 said she came out of the
medication room a few minutes later and went outside and saw
Youth A attempting to hit Youth E with a shovel and Staff 2
attempting to stop Youth A, while Staff 1 was across the yard with
Youth B talking with her. Staff 3 said she called 911 and then got
between Youth A and Youth E and was redirecting Youth E while
Staff 2 got the shovel from Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth E pushed
past her and began to attack Youth A, at the same time Youth B
came running across the yard and joined Youth E attacking Youth
A. Staff 3 said she attempted to put Youth B in an upper torso
however she was not able to. Staff 3 said Youth C joined in and
was kicking Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth B began to pull Youth A’s
hair out of her head when Staff 1 hovered over Youth A to protect
her from the other youth. Staff 3 said at that time she attempted to
put Youth C in a restraint however Youth C threw her to the
ground. Staff 3 said Youth E yelled that Staff 1 was getting kicked
and all the youth stopped fighting and backed away from Staff 1
and Youth A. Staff 3 said the police and ambulance arrived and
took Youth A, Youth B and Youth E to the hospital for exams. Staff
3 said she felt that the staff did everything they were able to do to
prevent and stop the physical altercation.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had a disciplinary action on
9/18/2023 for lack of supervision of youth due to being on
6

her cell phone. Staff 1 completed Youth Supervision training
on 1/8/2024.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 did not have any disciplinary
action in her file. Staff 2 completed Youth Supervision
training on 1/8/2024.
• Staff 3’s personnel file: Staff 3 had a disciplinary action on
2/8/2024 for violating the facility personal cell phone policy
and allowing a youth to make a phone call to another staff
from her personal cell phone. Staff 3 completed Youth
Supervision training on 1/26/2024.
• Incident Reports from 2/25/2024 for Youth A, Youth B,
Youth C and Youth E regarding the physical altercation. The
incident reports are consistent with staff’s interviews.
• Youth A’s safety plan dated January 3, 2024. The safety
plan outlines the expectations that Youth A will not be alone
with any other youth at any time.
• Youth A’s after visit summary from MyMichigan Medical
Center. Youth A’s diagnosis was “assault victim, bruises of
right breast and left shoulder, abrasions of right posterior
thorax”.
• Youth B’s aftercare summary from McLaren Central
Michigan Emergency Department. Youth B was diagnosed
with “Alleged Assault, Multiple abrasions, and Corneal
abrasion”.
• Youth E’s aftercare summary from McLaren Central
Michigan Emergency Department. Youth E was diagnosed
with “hand abrasion, and hand swelling”.
Video Review:
Video footage of February 25, 2024, New Hope Center house was
reviewed on March 11, 2024. The facility has two camera systems,
and the times are not in sync however the sequence of events in
the house were able to be deciphered, there is no camera footage
of the outside. The footage showed Youth A, Youth B and Youth E
all inside the house at 15:20. Youth A goes outside at 15:28 with
Staff 1 and Staff 2. Youth B goes outside at 15:29. Staff 2 enters
the house at 15:33 and goes downstairs. Staff 2 is seen going
outside at 15:34 and Staff 1 is seen coming in at the same time
and going into the kitchen. Staff 1 is seen going back outside at
15:35. The police are seen entering the house at 15:37.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Sufficiency of Staff. After
review of video footage, and interviews with youth and staff it is
determined the staff were present throughout the incident and did
what they were able to do in order to prevent, and stop the
physical altercation.
7

Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Incident reporting
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150
Section (3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent without legal
Description permission, then the institution shall immediately report the
information to law enforcement, the parent/ legal guardian or next
of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth ran away on 2/22/2024 and 2/23/2024. Youth returned to
the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on February 27,
2024. Complainant said she was notified of Youth A’s AWOLs on
the day’s she went AWOL.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 26, 2024. Youth A said on February 22, 2024, she left
from school due to her peers threatening her and not feeling safe
returning to the facility. Youth A said the police found her and
brought her back to the facility that afternoon. Youth A said on
February 23, 2024, she walked out of the facility and went up the
street and then returned the facility a few hours later.
DCWL Consultant was interviewed via telephone on February
26, 2024. DCWL Consultant reported she was notified of both of
Youth A’s AWOLs within the required timeframe.
Foster Care Worker reported on February 27, 2024, she was
notified of Youth A’s AWOL’s on February 22, 2024, and February
23, 2024.
Documents Reviewed:
• New Hope Center internal incident report dated 2/22/2024,
noting that Youth A went AWOL from school. Notifications
were all documented as being met within the required
timeframe.
• New Hope Center internal incident report dated 2/23/2024,
noting that Youth A went AWOL from the facility by exiting
out of her bedroom window. Notifications were all
documented as being met within the required timeframes.
8

Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Incident reporting as all
required individuals report they were notified of Youth A’s AWOL’s
within the required timeframes.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
